{"step_by_step_thinking": "Schedule H, G, X, and M are all categories of drugs under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act of India. Schedule H and X drugs are prescription drugs. However, Schedule X drugs are a subset of Schedule H drugs and have more stringent regulations. They require a duplicate copy of the prescription to be retained by the pharmacist and the prescription must be signed by the practitioner with a date and a serial number. Therefore, the drug that must be sold only on production of a prescription by a registered medical practitioner is a Schedule X drug.", "answer_choice": "C"}
